[[Beirut]], [[Lebanon]] | death_date = | instrument = [[Guitar]], [[human voice|vocals]] | genre = [[Blues]] | occupation = [[Guitarist]], [[singer]], [[songwriter]] | years_active = Early 1980s-present | label = [[Sequel Records|Sequel]], various | associated_acts = | website = {{URL|http://www.otisgrand.com/|Official website}} }} '''Otis Grand''' (born February 14, 1950, [[Beirut]], [[Lebanon]]){{cite web|author= |url=http://www.allmusic.com/artist/otis-grand-mn0000489450/biography |title=Otis Grand | Biography |publisher=AllMusic |date=1950-02-14 |accessdate=2014-01-28}} is an [[United States|American]] [[blues]] [[musician]], best known for his [[album]], ''Perfume and Grime'' (1996). ==Biography== Although born in Beirut, Grand has spent much of his life in the [[United States]].{{cite book | first= Tony | last= Russell | year= 1997 | title= The Blues: From Robert Johnson to Robert Cray | edition= | publisher= Carlton Books Limited | location= Dubai | pages= 114–115 | isbn= 1-85868-255-X}} He played with local blues musicians at Eli's Mile High Club in [[Oakland, California|Oakland]], [[California]], and made contacts that would later prove useful; such as [[Joe Louis Walker]] who [[record producer|produced]] his debut album, ''Always Hot'' (1988). He later cited his early influences as being [[B.B. King]], [[Otis Rush]], [[Johnny Otis]] and [[T-Bone Walker]].{{cite web | url = http://www.music.us/biography/artist/10853/otis_grand.html | title = Otis Grand Biography | publisher= Music.us | accessdate= December 2009 }} By the late 1980s, Grand was based in the [[United Kingdom|UK]] where he and his Dance Kings became a popular [[nightclub]] act. He was voted 'Best UK Blues Guitarist' seven years running (1990–1996) by the British ''Blues Connection'' magazine.{{cite web | url = http://www.bluesmusicnow.com/grand82.html | title = An interview with Otis Grand| publisher=Blues Music Now! | accessdate= December 2009 }} In 1991, Grand co-starred with his backing band and [[Guitar Shorty]], on the ''[[My Way or the Highway (album)|My Way or the Highway]]'' album. Joe Louis Walker also played on Grand's next [[album]], ''He Knows the Blues'' (1992) alongside Calvin Owens, [[Alfred "Pee Wee" Ellis]], and the singer [[Jimmy Nelson (singer)|Jimmy Nelson]]. The album was nominated for a [[Blues Music Award|W.C. Handy Award]].{{cite web | url = http://www.otisgrand.com/biography.htm |title=Biography|publisher=Otisgrand.com|accessdate= December 2009}} ''Nothing Else Matters'' (1994) involved [[Curtis Salgado]], [[Sugar Ray Norcia]], and [[Kim Wilson]], whilst Walker and Salgado returned for ''Perfume and Grime'' (1996) which also utilised [[Luther Allison]] and [[Darrell Nulisch]]. In 1997 Grand guested on Joe Louis Walker's album, ''[[Great Guitars]]''. In March 2009, Grand appeared on stage at the Arts Centre in [[Cranleigh]], [[Surrey]], [[England]].{{cite web | url = http://forum.surrey-online.co.uk/board/local-news/topic/297/action/view_topic/eclectic-live-music-presents-otis-grand-s-big-blue | title = Eclectic Live Music presents Otis Grand's Big Blue | publisher=Forum.surrey-online.co.uk|accessdate=December 2009}} In addition to living in Lebanon and the United States, Grand has lived in [[France]] and currently resides in [[Croydon]], England, Grand remains an incisive guitarist. His latest album, ''Hipster Blues'', was released on May 21, 2007.{{cite web|url=http://www.allmusic.com/album/hipster-blues-mw0001127918 |title=Hipster Blues - Otis Grand | Songs, Reviews, Credits, Awards |publisher=AllMusic |date=2007-05-21 |accessdate=2014-01-28}} ==Selected discography== *''Always Hot'' (1988) - Indigo *''He Knows the Blues'' (1990) - [[Volt Records|Volt]] *''Nothing Else Matters'' (1995) - [[Sanctuary Records|Sanctuary]] *''Perfume and Grime'' (1996) - [[Sequel Records|Sequel]] *''Grand Union'' (1998) - Valley Entertainment - (with [[Anson Funderburgh]] and [[Debbie Davies]]) *''Hipster Blues'' (2007) - Bliss Street ==References== {{Reflist|refs= {{cite web|author= |url=http://www.allmusic.com/artist/otis-grand-mn0000489450/discography |title=Otis Grand | Discography |publisher=AllMusic |date=1950-02-14 |accessdate=2014-01-28}} }} ==External links== * {{Official website|1=http://www.otisgrand.com}} * [http://www.nme.com/artists/otis-grand Videos and photograph] at [[NME]] {{Authority control|VIAF=63620107}} {{Persondata | NAME =Grand, Otis | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION =[[United States|American]] [[blues]] musician | DATE OF BIRTH =February 14, 1950 | PLACE OF BIRTH =[[Beirut]], [[Lebanon]] | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Grand, Otis}} [[Category:1950 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:American blues musicians]] [[Category:American blues guitarists]] [[Category:American blues singers]] [[Category:American songwriters]]
